fields.summary: iOS : TableView - Touch end events are fired twice per row after the table view is displayed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Install and launch KS from 2_0_X branch
2. Go to Base UI > Views > Table Views > Touch Events
3. Press and hold on a row with "Row Label" under your finger 
4. Slightly shift the weight of your finger up and down

Actual: Contents in the row becomes invisible. If you press on the area where the label used to appear, the content appears again.
Expected: Contents in the row should not become invisible.

Note: Bug does not appear in sdk build 1.8.2
fields.summary: iOS: TableView Events - After long pressing on a row, the contents in the row becomes invisible
fields.environment:
SDK build: 2.0.0.GA, 2.0.1.v20120406170211
Titanium Studio, build: 2.0.1.201204061639
xcode: 4.3
Device: ipad 3 (5.1)

comments.body: Commit [edcd9fe3d32000f0dbc8aef29b278cf9cc1c075a|https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/commit/edcd9fe3d32000f0dbc8aef29b278cf9cc1c075a] identified as the first bad commit. Commit fixed TIMOB-7633.

Actual Result:

Contents in the row does not become invisible.

Tested with Titanium SDK: 2.1.0.v20120604151821
Tested with Titanium Â Studio: 2.1.0.201206010843
Device - iPad 3 (5.1)
